titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Browne, Commonplace Book
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:57
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: [Commonplace book].

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Copies of Parliamentary papers, including speeches, orders, petitions, and declarations. Most printed in Lords Journals or in Rushworth. Includes items from parliaments of Elizabeth I through James II, most between 1630-1680.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: For provenance information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Osborn fb155 is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Browne, Commonplace Book. James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing list or card set. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained; the volume may contain additional unlisted material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following finding aid is a complete inventory of the contents of Osborn fb155. This list was reformatted from previously existing cataloging.

controlaccess.subject: Law -- Great Britain
Nobility -- Great Britain
controlaccess.geogname: Great Britain -- Religious life and customs -- 17th century
controlaccess.persname: Henrietta Maria, Queen, consort of Charles I, King of England, 1609-1669

did.unittitle: Osborn fb155
JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
[Speeches to Parliament, 5 & 8 April 1614]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
12 p.
MS copy in the hand of John Browne.
On elections, religion, and supply.
Printed in Cobbett's Parliamentary
History, vi, 1149.
p.1-12.

did.unittitle: JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
[Commission to Sir John Digby to be an ambassador to Spain, 1617 April 16]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Commission to John Digby, 1st earl of
Bristol (1580-1653) to negotiate for
a Spanish match for Prince Charles.
p.13-14.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN, COURT OF STAR CHAMBER
"The heads of the charges against Earl of Oxford" c. Apr 1622

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
Henry de Vere, 18th earl of Oxford
(1593-1635) charged with attacks on
the King's government.
p.15.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN, PRIVY COUNCIL.
"At the Court in Whitehall, 15 Jan 1620"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Appointment of a commission to
consider the recovery of the
Palatinate.
p.16-17.

did.unittitle: DORSET, EDWARD SACKVILLE, 4TH EARL OF, 1591-1652
[Speech in the House of Commons urging that subsidies be given for the recovery of the Palatinate, 1621 Nov 26]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
MS copy. Rushworth, vi, 131.
(Rushworth incorrectly attributes the
speech to 1623; see DNB).
p.17-22.

did.unittitle: WIMBLEDON, SIR EDWARD CECIL, 1ST VISCOUNT, 1572-1638
[Speech in the House of Commons, 5 Feb 1620/1]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
Urges Commons to grant supply for
the recovery of the Palatinate.
Calendared in CSPD, 1619-1623, p.220;
Gardiner, in "History of England",
v.4, p.29, claims that this speech
is a forgery.
p.23-28.

did.unittitle: PERROT, SIR JAMES, 1517-1637
"A true copie of the motion made in the Commons house of Parliament the 14th of June 1621. By Sir James Perrot, Knt..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
4 p.
MS copy.
A report of Perrot's speech
supporting true religion and the
Palatinate and a copy of the
Declaration passed by the Commons on
these same issues. Rushworth, I, 36
(Declaration), Cobbett's
Parliamentary History, vi, 1293
(speech).
p.29-32.

did.unittitle: JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
[Letter to the Speaker of the House of Commons warning Parliament not to meddle in matters under the royal prerogative, 1621 Dec 3]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy. Rushworth, I, 43.
p.33-34.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1621. HOUSE OF COMMONS
[Petition and remonstrance to King James I against the spread of popery, 1621 Dec 8]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
MS copy. Rushworth, I, 40.
p.35-40.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1621. HOUSE OF COMMONS
[Remonstrance or Apology sent to King James I, 1621 Dec 8]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
5 p.
MS copy.
Explanation of Parliament's actions.
Rushworth, I, 44.
p.41-45.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1621. HOUSE OF COMMONS
[Heads for a petitions for the better execution of laws against seminary priests and Popish recusants, c Dec 1621]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Measures against Catholics.
p.46-47.

did.unittitle: JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
[Answer to the petition of the House of Commons concerning its privileges, 1621 Dec 12]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
11 p.
MS copy. Rushworth, I, 46.
p.48-59.

did.unittitle: JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
[The King's letter to Secretary Calvert to be conveyed to the House of Commons, 1621 Dec 16]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy.
Clarification of an earlier message
on the Commons privileges (see
p.48-59 this volume). Cobbett's
Parliamentary History, v.i, 1350.
p.60-62.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1621. HOUSE OF COMMONS
[The Protestation of the House of Commons concerning its privileges, 1621 Dec 18]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy. Rushworth, I, 53.
p.63-64.

did.unittitle: JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
"His Majesty's letter to the Speaker, 17 Dec 1621"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Threatens to dismiss Parliament if
members refuse to return to business.
Cobbett's Parliamentary History, v.i,
1355.
p.65-66.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1621. HOUSE OF COMMONS
[Petition to the King for a recess rather than an adjournment, 1621 Dec 18]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy.
Cobbett's Parliamentary History, v.i,
1359. Followed by the King's reply,
19 Dec 1621 (p.68).
p.67.

did.unittitle: [ANONYMOUS]
[Newsletter]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
MS copy.
News of the Thirty Years' War and the
English ambassador's (John Digby, 1st
earl of Bristol) efforts to persuade
the Emperor to restore the Palatinate
to the elector, Frederick.
p.69-74.

did.unittitle: FERDINAND II, EMPEROR OF GERMANY, 1578-1637
[Letter to James I, 1621/2 Jan 14]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy. In Latin.
p.75.

did.unittitle: WILLIAMS, JOHN, ABP. OF YORK, 1582-1650
"A speech of Lord Keeper Williams in Chancery, 9 Oct 1621"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
8 p.
MS copy.
His speech upon assuming office,
apologizing for his inexperience in
law and setting forth his intentions.
Includes comments on the law of
equity and on lawyers.
p.76-83.

did.unittitle: JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
"King James answer to King Fernando, 12 Nov 1621"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
5p.
MS copy.
Proposals of peace to end the
Bohemian Wars. Ferdinand II, Emperor
of Germany, 1578-1637. Friedrich I,
King of Bohemia and Elector Palatine,
1596-1632. Thirty Years' War.
p.84-88.

did.unittitle: YELVERTON, SIR HENRY, 1566-1629
[Speech of Submission in Star Chamber, 1620 Oct 27]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
4 p.
MS copy.
Acknowledges his fault in the matter
of the Charter for London.
Calendared under this date in CSPD,
1619-1623, p.186. MS is dated "Nov
1620".
p.92.

did.unittitle: CHARLES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1600-1649
[Speech to Parliament asking for supply for the War in the Palatinate, 1625 June 18]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy. LJ, III, 435.
p.93-94.

did.unittitle: WILLIAMS, JOHN, ABP. OF YORK, 1582-1650
[The Lord Keeper's Speech to Parliament of the need for subsidies for the war in the Palatinate, 1625 June 18]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy. LJ, III, 436.
f.94-96.

did.unittitle: CREWE, SIR THOMAS, 1565-1634
[The speech of the Speaker of the House of Commons at his presentation to the King, 1625 June 20]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
7 p.
MS copy.
Also the speech of acceptance of the
Speaker by the Lord Keeper.
LJ, III, 437 (in part).
f.96-102.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1625.
"A Petition delivered from both houses of Parliament to his Majesty... 1625 June 24"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy.
Petition for a day of fast and
repentance. Reported in Cobbett's
Parliamentary History, v.2, p 5.
p.103.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1625.
[The petition of both houses against papists, 1625 July 6]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
MS copy. LJ, III, 419 (with the
King's answers).
p.104-109.

did.unittitle: COKE, SIR EDWARD, 1552-1634
[Speech in Parliament, 1625 Aug 5]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy.
Demands the King undertake financial
reform rather than depending on
subsidies from Parliament. Reported
in Cobbett's Parliamentary History,
v.2, p.12.
p.110-112.

did.unittitle: CHARLES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1600-1649
[Speech to the Parliament meeting at Oxford asking for supply to carry out the War for the recovery of the Palatinate, 1625 Aug 14]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
5 p.
MS copy.
Followed by the speeches of the
King's ministers, Lord Conway and Sir
John Coke, declaring the state of the
King's affairs. LJ, III, 1470.
p.113-117.

did.unittitle: BUCKINGHAM, GEORGE VILLIERS, 1ST DUKE OF, 1592-1628
[Speech to Parliament, 1625 Aug 8]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
10 p.
MS copy.
A short introductory speech by Lord
Keeper Williams on the petition
against papists (see p.128-130 this
volume), followed by Buckingham's
speech on war preparations.
Rushworth, I, 188.
p.118-127.

did.unittitle: CHARLES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1600-1649
[Answer to Parliament's petition against papists, 1625 Aug 8]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy. LJ, III, 479.
p.128-130.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1625. HOUSE OF COMMONS
[Declaration of the House of Commons to the King protesting Parliament's loyalty upon the dismissal of the Oxford Parliament, 1625 Aug 12]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy. Rushworth, 1, p.170.
p.131.

did.unittitle: [ANONYMOUS]
"An Advertisement to a Friende" [c 1625 Aug]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Newsletter on the dissolution of the
Oxford Parliament and their
discontent. Includes comments on the
designs of George Villiers, 1st
duke of Buckingham (1592-1628) and
the opposition of Sir Robert Mansell
(1573-1656).
p.132-133.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. TREATIES
[Articles of marriage between the Elector Palatine and the Princess Elizabeth, c.1612]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy. In Latin.
Elizabeth of England, consort of
Frederick I, 1596-1662.
p.134-136.

did.unittitle: GREGORIUS XV, POPE, 1554-1623
[Letter to the Bishop of Corches, Inquisitor-general in Spain, 1623 April 19]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
p.137-138.

did.unittitle: CHARLES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1600-1649
[The Prince of England's letter to Pope Gregory on the Spanish Match, 1623 July 8]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Pope Gregorius XV, 1554-1623. A
different version of this letter is
printed in Rushworth, v.i, 82, dated
1623 June 20.
p.139-140.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. TREATIES.
[Marriage treaty between Charles I and Henrietta Maria, 1624 Nov 30]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
7 p.
MS copy.
Articles of marriage including
provisions for the dowry and
religious concessions made to
Henrietta Maria, Queen Consort of
Charles I, 1609-1669.
p.141-147.

did.unittitle: JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
[Speech to Parliament asking for advice on foreign affairs, 1623/4 Feb 19]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
4 p.
MS copy. LJ, III, 209.
p.148-151.

did.unittitle: WILLIAMS, JOHN, ABP. OF YORK, 1582-1650
[The Lord Keeper's speech to Parliament, 1623/4 Feb 19]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Praises King James' speech at the
opening of Parliament.
p.151-152.

did.unittitle: BUCKINGHAM, GEORGE VILLIERS, 1ST DUKE OF, 1592-1628
[Report of the Duke's speech to Parliament, 1623/4 Feb 24]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
13 p.
MS copy.
Report on the Spanish marriage
negotiations. LJ, III, 220.
p.152-164.

did.unittitle: CREWE, SIR THOMAS, 1565-1634
[The speech of the Speaker of the House of Commons at his presentation; the speech of the Lord Keeper, 1623/4 Feb 21]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
11 p.
MS copy. LJ, III, 211.
p.165-175.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1624.
[Conference between two houses, 1623/4 Mar 2]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
5 p.
MS copy.
Concerning the breaking off of the
Spanish treaties. Speeches by John
Williams, Abp. of York and Lord
Keeper, George Abbott, Abp. of
Canterbury, and Sir Edward Coke. The
two houses agree to advise the King
to break off the treaties.
LJ, III, 242.
p.176-180.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1624.
[The reasons of the House of Commons for breaking off the Spanish treaties, with additional reasons added by the House of Lords, 1623/4 Mar 5]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy. LJ, III, 246.
p.181-183.

did.unittitle: FELIPE IV, KING OF SPAIN, 1605-1665
[Letter to Gaspar de Guzman, Conde-duque de Olivares (1587-1645) on the marriage negotiations with the Prince of Wales, 1622 Nov 5]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy. In English.
LJ, III, 226.
p.183-184.

did.unittitle: OLIVARES, GASPAR DE GUZMAN, CONDE-DUQUE DE, 1587-1645
[Letter to Felipe IV, King of Spain, about the marriage alliance with England, 1622 Nov 8]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
5 p.
MS copy. In English.
In response to the King's letter
(see p.183).
LJ, III, 226.
p.184-188.

did.unittitle: PORTLAND, RICHARD WESTON, 1ST EARL OF, 1577-1635
"Collections out of Sir Richard Weston's report to the lower House 1623/4 March 4"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
4 p.
MS copy.
Report on the trip of George
Villiers, 1st duke of Buckingham, and
Charles I, King of Great Britain,
into Spain.
p.188-191.

did.unittitle: COTTINGTON, FRANCIS COTTINGTON, 1ST BARON, 1578?-1652
[Report to Parliament, 1623/4 March 4]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy.
Report on the Spanish journey and
negotiations for the Spanish
marriage.
p.191-193.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1624.
[Message to the King advising him to break off the Spanish treaties, 1623/4 Mar 5]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy. LJ, III, 250.
p.194.

did.unittitle: JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
[Answer to the Parliament's message concerning the breaking off of the Spanish treaties, 1623/4 Mar 5]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
5 p.
MS copy. LJ, III, 250.
p.195-199.

did.unittitle: CHARLES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1600-1649
"The Prince his Speech to a Committee of both houses, 11 March 1623[-4]"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Clarification of his father's speech
on subsidies and war with Spain.
LJ, III, 257.
p.200-201.

did.unittitle: JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
[Speech to Parliament on the war to recover the Palatinate, 1623/4 Mar 14]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
5 p.
MS copy. LJ, III, 265.
p.202-206.

did.unittitle: BUCKINGHAM, GEORGE VILLIERS, 1ST DUKE OF, 1592-1628
[Speech to Parliament, 1623/4 March 1 or 17]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy.
On the Spanish marriage, Spain and
the Palatinate. Dated both 15 and 17
March.
p.207-209.

did.unittitle: JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
[A summary of the King's letter to Parliament affirming his willingness to break off the Spanish treaties, 1623/4 Mar 17]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy (summary).
The complete letter is printed in LJ,
III, 265.
p.210.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1624.
"Articles to be seen into speedily" [c.1623/4 March]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy.
Articles concern the defenses of the
Kingdom, the armed forces, and steps
to be taken against Catholics.
p.211.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1624.
[The speech at the presentation of the subsidies, 1623/4 Mar 23]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy.
Promise the King support in war
against Spain. LJ, III, 275.
p.212-214.

did.unittitle: JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
[Answer to Parliament's petition on breaking off the Spanish treaties, 1623/4 March 23]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Agrees to break treaties.
LJ, III, 282.
p.214-215.

did.unittitle: CREWE, SIR THOMAS, 1565-1634
[Speech of the Speaker at the prorogation of Parliament, 1624 May 28]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
7 p.
MS copy. LJ, III, 423.
p.216-222.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. TREATIES, 1603-1625 (JAMES I)
"A Brief of the Articles of the League between the Kings of France, England, the Commonwealth of Venice, and the Duke of Savoy" [1624]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Defensive and offensive league
against the Spanish.
p.223-224.

did.unittitle: NORTHUMBERLAND, HENRY PERCY, 9TH EARL OF, 1564-1632
[The Earl of Northumberland's discourse on the proceedings between himself and Sir Francis Vere, 1602 April 23]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
MS copy.
Northumberland's account of his
differences with Sir Francis Vere
(1560-1609) and his attempt to settle
them by a duel. The duel was
prevented by Vere's refusal and the
Queen's order.
p.225-230.

did.unittitle: BOLEYN, ANNE, CONSORT OF HENRY VIII, 1507-1536
"Queen Anne Bollens letter to King Henry the 8th found among Cromwell's Papers [1536] May 6"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy. Asks for a lawful trial to
prove her innocence.
p.231-233.

did.unittitle: ELIZABETH I, QUEEN OF ENGLAND, 1533-1603
[Message to the House of Commons on unruly members, 1571 May 27]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy. Cobbett, i, 766.
p.234-235.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. SOVEREIGNS, ETC., 1603-1625 (JAMES I)
[Proclamations, 1610 March 25]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy.
A proclamation for the calling in of
"The Interpretor" by Dr. John Cowell
(1554-1611), due to its harmful
effects towards both the King and
Parliament.
p.235-237.

did.unittitle: MAYNARD, SIR JOHN, 1602-1690
[Letter to "one about the King", London, 1648 August]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy.
Newsletter on events in London,
Parliament, and the Army. The letter
was apparently not sent.
p.237-239.

did.unittitle: CHARLES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1600-1649
[The King's reasons for declining the jurisdiction of the High Court of Justice, 1648/9 Jan 21]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
5 p.
MS copy.
Rushworth, v.7, 1403.
p.239-243.

did.unittitle: LONDON. MINISTERS.
[Queries concerning the oath by the 6th canon (the etcetera oath), ca. 1640]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
7 p.
MS copy.
Questions the legality and meaning of
the Etcetera Oath of 1640.
p.243-247.

did.unittitle: ANDERSON, SIR EDMUND, 1530-1605
[Legal writings concerning imprisonment without causes shown, ca. late 16th century]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
MS copy (extracts).
On habeas corpus and other legal
remedies.
p.247-252.

did.unittitle: WESTMINSTER ASSEMBLY OF DIVINES
"Declaration against the Blasphemous opinions in Mr. Archer's book, by the Assembly of Divines and by the authority of parliament" [1645 July 17]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
4 p.
MS copy.
A refutation of Archer's blasphemy
that God is the author of all sin.
Printed in 1645. John Archer,
Preacher of All Hallows, Lombard St.,
Comfort for all believers.
p.252-255.

did.unittitle: OXFORD UNIVERSITY
"Protestation of the Doctors of Oxford, 1641/2 Feb 18"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Declaration of loyalty to Church and
King. Followed by a list of
supporters and opponents of the
Protestation.
p.245-257.

did.unittitle: HENRIETTA MARIA, QUEEN CONSORT OF CHARLES I
[Protestation to the States General of the Low Countries on her Majesty's departure from Scheveling, 1643 Feb 25]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Complains of her treatment, the
arrest of her ship, and the refusal
of the States General to aid Charles
I. The Protestation was issued by the
English resident Sir William Boswell
(d.1649) on order of the Queen.
p.257-258.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1643
"An answer intended by both houses to be sent to the King April 1643 but not sent"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
MS copy.
Objections to King Charles the 1st's
terms for peace.
p.259-264.

did.unittitle: [ANONYMOUS]
[The oath of the clerk of parliament]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy [17th century].
p.264.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. ARMY. COUNCIL.
[Proposals sent by the general and Council of the Army to the commissioners of Parliament, 1647 Aug 1]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
12 p.
MS copy.
Proposals for reforms in the
government, parliament, etc.
Rushworth, v.7, 731.
p.264-277.

did.unittitle: CHARLES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1600-1649
[Grant to Murrough O'Brien Inchiquin, 1st earl and 6th baron of Munster, Ireland (1614-1674), and instructions to the Lord President, 1644/5 Jan 14]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
7 p.
MS copy [17th century].
The appointment is made with the
"advise and consent of Parliament."
The instructions concern governmental
and military duties. London, 1641.
p.277-283.

did.unittitle: CHARLES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1600-1649
"The Kings manifest touching the Palatine Cause" [1641]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
MS copy [17th century].
Summary of England's past support of
the Palatinate and a declaration that
King Charles will attempt once again
to treat for peace at the Diet of
Ratisbon. Printed in London, 1641.
p.283-288.

did.unittitle: SWEDEN. SOVEREIGNS, 1632-1654 (CHRISTIANA)
[Propositions of the Queen of Sweden's commissioners to the Parliament of England, and the answers of Parliament, 1645 Mar 31]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
9 p.
MS copy.
Swedish request for aid in their War
against the Danes and the Emperor.
p.288-296.

did.unittitle: SCOTLAND. COMMISSIONERS IN LONDON, 1646
[Letter to the English Parliament, 1645/6 Jan 24]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
7 p.
MS copy.
Complaint of false accusations
against the Army and Kingdom of
Scotland. LJ, VIII, 123.
p.296-302.

did.unittitle: BROWNE, JOHN, D.1691
[Forms of direction for royal letters]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
Autograph MS [17th century].
Proper addresses for Barons, Dukes,
Bishops, etc.
p.303.

did.unittitle: BROWNE, JOHN, D.1691
[List of Cathedral and Collegiate Churches in England and Wales]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
Autograph MS [17th century].
List divided into churches of the
old and the new foundations.
p.304-305.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. PARLIAMENT, 1649. HOUSE OF COMMONS
"An Act for erecting a High Court of Justice for trying and judging of James Earl of Cambridge, Henry Earl of Holland, George Lord Goring, Arthur Lord Capel, and Sir John Owen." [1648/9 Feb 3]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy.
The prisoners are accused of levying
civil war against Parliament. James
Hamilton, 2nd earl of Cambridge
(1608-1649); Henry Rich, 1st earl of
Holland (1590-1649); George Goring,
baron (1608-1657); Arthur Capel,
baron (1610?-1649); Sir John Owen
(1600-1666).
p.306-308.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. HIGH COURT OF JUSTICE.
[Order to the Sheriff of Middlesex to carry out the sentence against James Earl of Cambridge, 1648/9 Mar 6]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
The Earl was convicted of treason
and sentenced to death.
Document includes list of the judges
and a note that the same sentence was
passed against the Earl of Holland
and Lord Capel.
p.308-309.

did.unittitle: JAMES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1566-1625
[Instructions for Viscount Falkland on his appointment as lord deputy of Ireland, 1622 Aug 4]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
11 p.
Contemporary MS copy (signed "Copia
Veria, H.Falkland, Geo.Calvert").
Ordered to take special care of
religion, the settlement of land,
and the King's revenues. Henry Cary,
1st viscount Falkland, d.1633;
George Calvert, 1st lord Baltimore
(1580?-1632).
p.310-320.

did.unittitle: ORDER OF THE GARTER
[Statutes and ordinances of the Order of the Garter, as reformed by Henry VIII, with additions by Philip and Mary, 16th century]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
34 p.
MS copy [17th century].
Rules, customs, officers, etc. of
the Order.
p.321-354.

did.unittitle: CHARLES II, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1630-1685
[Grant to Sir Richard Browne (bart., c.1605-1683) of the office of Muster Master General, 1682 Mar 30]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy [17th century].
p.355.

did.unittitle: BROWNE, JOHN, D.1691
"A Table of the several revenues and tenths of every Bishopric in England and Wales"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Autograph MS [c.17th century].
p.356-357.

did.unittitle: BROWNE, JOHN, D.1691
[Notes concerning proceedings in Chancery]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
Autograph MS [17th century].
The jurisdiction of the Court of
Chancery in cases of equity and
conscience. Citations of statutes
and arguments.
p.358-361.

did.unittitle: BROWNE, JOHN, D.1691
"Some queries and resolutions concerning the course of the convocation"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
Autograph MS.
Ten questions and answers, including
how convocation is summoned and
dismissed, the membership, etc.
p.361-363.

did.unittitle: LOUIS XIV, KING OF FRANCE, 1638-1715
[Letters to the Pope and to certain cardinals, 1662 Aug 30]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Complains of the attack on his
ambassador by the Pope's soldiers in
the streets of Rome and demands
satisfaction. Pope Alexander VII
(1599-1667); Charles de Blanchefort,
duc de Crequy (1623-1687). See p.385
for another copy.
p.364-365.

did.unittitle: MIDDLESEX, LIONEL CRANFIELD, 3RD EARL OF, 1625-1674
[Challenge to a duel sent to John Egerton, 2nd earl of Bridgewater (1622-1686), 1633]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy.
p.366.

did.unittitle: STRAFFORD, THOMAS WENTWORTH, 1ST EARL OF, 1593-1641
[Proposition sent to the King for securing his Majesty's estate for the bridling of Parliament, and for the increase of revenue]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
12 p.
MS copy.
Proposals to fortify the Kingdom,
limit the power of Parliament,
impose yearly taxes, etc. Published
in 1646 with title, Straffords Plot
Discovered. This treatise was
written by Sir Robert Dudley
(1574-1649) in 1614, and in 1630 was
used as evidence in a Star Chamber
suit against Sir Robert Cotton (see
p.463-470).
p.367-378.

did.unittitle: RALEIGH, SIR WALTER, 1552?-1618
[Letter to King James I, 1618 Oct]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Letter sent "a little before his
death." A defense of his actions
and a protestation of his loyalty.
p.379-380.

did.unittitle: RALEIGH, SIR WALTER, 1552?-1618
[His Protestation at his death, 1618 Oct]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Denies the accusations made against
him.
p.381-382.

did.unittitle: SHELDON, GILBERT, ABP. OF CANTERBURY, 1598-1677
[Letter to Humphrey Henchman, bp. of London (1592-1675), to be communicated to all the Bishops of his province, 1669 June 8]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
On suppressing conventicles.
p.382-383.

did.unittitle: HENCHMAN, HUMPHREY, BP. OF LONDON, 1592-1675
[Letter to Joseph Henshaw, Bp. of Peterborough (1603-1679), 1669 June 20, and the Archdeacons Instructions, 1669 July 7]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy.
Letters on suppressing conventicles
followed by instructions on the same.
p.383-384.

did.unittitle: LOUIS XIV, KING OF FRANCE, 1638-1715
[Letter to the Pope, 1662 Aug 30]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy.
In English.
Another copy of letter on p.364.
p.385

did.unittitle: RUVIGNY AND RAINEVAL, HENRI, MARQUIS OF, 1648-1720
[A paper brought into the House of Lords from the French Ambassador, 1673/4 Jan 25]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
MS copy.
On the alliance between France and
England and the war against the
Dutch.
p.386-401.

did.unittitle: MONMOUTH, JAMES SCOTT, DUKE OF, 1649-1685
[Letter to the Vice Chancellor of Cambridge University, 1674 Oct]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Orders the clergy to reform their
hairstyles and their manner of
preaching.
p.401-402.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN TREATIES (CHARLES II, 1660-1685)
"The heads of the Articles between the King of Great Britain and the States of the United Provinces, 1673"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
4 p.
MS copy.
Peace treaty; includes "Private
Articles" of peace between England
and Holland.
p.402-405.

did.unittitle: [ANONYMOUS]
"A Petition to the Queen for Association in Religion"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
14 p.
MS copy c. 1584.
Recommends an oath for the defense
of the Queen and the Protestant
religion. Includes comments on
various religious groups.
p.405-418.

did.unittitle: [ANONYMOUS]
[Petition to the Archbishops and Bishops, c.1602]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
16 p.
MS copy.
Argues against the toleration of
Catholics and maintains that
dangerous Catholics are being favored
while loyal Puritans are suffering.
p.419-434.

did.unittitle: LUZANCY, MONSIEUR DE
[Statement of his case against St. Germain, 1675 Oct]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
5 p.
MS copy.
The case of M. de Luzancy, a French
Preacher "newly converted" to
Protestantism, against a French
Jesuit who tried to re-convert him.
The case was debated in the Commons,
1675 Nov 8. CJ, ix, 369, 375.
p.435-439.

did.unittitle: MANCHESTER, HENRY MONTAGU, 1ST EARL OF, 1563?-1642
[Letter to his son, Walter Montagu (1603-1677), concerning his son's conversion to Catholicism, 1635]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
10 p.
MS copy. Printed in 1641.
p.440-449.

did.unittitle: LUCAS, JOHN LUCAS, 1ST BARON OF, 1606-1671
[Speech in the House of Lords against granting a large subsidy to the King, 1669/70 Feb 22]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
4 p.
MS copy.
Cobbett, v.4, 473.
p.450-453.

did.unittitle: BUCKINGHAM, GEORGE VILLIERS, 2ND DUKE OF, 1628-87
[Speech in the House of Lords favoring a Bill of Indulgence for Protestant dissenters, 1675 Oct]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy. Cobbett, v.4, 789.
p.453-454.

did.unittitle: SHAFTESBURY, ANTHONY ASHLEY COOPER, 1ST EARL OF, 1621-1683
[Letter to Charles Howard, 1st earl of Carlisle (1629-1685), 1675 Feb 3]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
On the necessity of calling a new
Parliament and his refusal to accept
office until one is called. Printed
in Brown, The First Earl of
Shaftesbury, p. 277.
p.455-456.

did.unittitle: [GREAT BRITAIN EXCHEQUER]
"Retrenchment of the King's expences" [c. later 17th century]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy.
List of the reduction in the
allowances of departments such as
the Household, Privy Purse, Secret
Service, etc.
p.456.

did.unittitle: CHARLES I, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1600-1649
[Commission to Thomas Howard, 2nd earl of Arundel (1585-1646), to be general of the army to be sent to the North, 1638]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
4 p.
MS copy.
p.457-460.

did.unittitle: GREAT BRITAIN. COURT OF THE LORD HIGH STEWARD
"The names of the peers in commission upon the trial of Lord Cornwallis, 1678 June 30"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
List of the peers who tried Charles
Cornwallis, 3rd baron of Cornwallis
(1655-1698), for manslaughter.
p.460-461.

did.unittitle: SHAFTESBURY, ANTHONY ASHLEY COOPER, 1ST EARL OF, 1621-1683
"The Substance of the Earl of Shaftesbury's Speech in the Court of Kings Bench, when he was brought thither by Habeas Corpus" [1677 June 29]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy.
Challenges the right of the House of
Lords to imprison him indefinitely.
Printed in 1679.
p.461-463.

did.unittitle: HEATH, SIR ROBERT, 1575-1649
[The Attorney General's information against Sir Robert Cotton and others, 1629]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
8 p.
MS copy.
Recommendation that Sir Robert Bruce
Cotton, bart. (1571-1631), and others
be proceeded against in Star Chamber
for circulating a slanderous treatise
harmful to the King. The content of
the treatise, "A Proposition for his
Majesty's service to bridle the
Impertinency of Parliaments", is
given by Sir Robert Dudley. See
p.367-378, where the same treatise is
attributed to the Earl of Strafford.
p.463-470.

did.unittitle: SCOTLAND.
[The Scots' reasons against the Book of Common Prayer, 1637 Aug]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
Objects to the Prayer Book as Popish
and full of errors.
p.470-472.

did.unittitle: [ANONYMOUS]
"A Narrative of the Life of John Packer, Esq."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
Anonymous MS copy.
Account of Packer's career and good
works (1572-1649).
p.472-477.

did.unittitle: ABBOT, GEORGE, ABP. OF CANTERBURY, 1582-1633
[Petition to the King against granting toleration to Roman Catholics, c.1624]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy. The petition is dated 1663
and attributed to Gilbert Sheldon,
Abp. of Canterbury (1598-1677), but
in Rushworth, I, 85, the petition is
attributed to Abbot. The DNB article
on Abbot mentions this petition and
claims it was a forgery.
p.478.

did.unittitle: USSHER, JAMES ABP. OF ARMAGH, 1581-1656
[Petition of the Irish bishops against Popery, 1626 Nov 26]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy.
Signed by Ussher and 11 other
bishops.
p.479.

did.unittitle: WIGORN, JOHN
[Statement of religious controversies c. 17th century]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy.
Criticizes those who "toss to and
fro" in religion.
p.480.

did.unittitle: SHAFTESBURY, ANTHONY ASHLEY COOPER, 1ST EARL OF, 1621-1683
"A Speech lately made by a noble Peere of the Realme in Parliament 1681"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
5 p.
MS copy.
The speech was never actually given
in Parliament. Printed in 1681 and
in Cobbett, v.4, cxi. Shaftesbury
advocates withholding supplies until
the King satisfies the people about
the succession of the Duke of York.
p.481-485.

did.unittitle: [PRESBYTERIANS IN ENGLAND]
[Address of the Presbyterian ministers of London to the King, 1687 April 30]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
1 p.
MS copy.
Thanks to the King for his
Declaration for liberty of
conscience.
p.486.

did.unittitle: FRIENDS, SOCIETY OF
[Address to the King, 1687]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
2 p.
MS copy.
Thanks to the King for his
Declaration for liberty of
conscience. p.486-487.

did.unittitle: JAMES II, KING OF GREAT BRITAIN, 1633-1701
"His Majesties gracious declaration to all his Loving Subjects for Liberty of conscience" [1687 April 4]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
4 p.
MS copy. Printed in 1687.
p.488-491.

did.unittitle: ROCHESTER, JOHN WILMOT, 2ND EARL OF, 1647-1680

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

1 p.
Deathbed letter of repentance to
Gilbert Burnet, bp. of Salisbury
(1643-1715) Published in 1680.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

MS copy. CJ, VIII, 442.
p.493-495.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:

MS copy.
Signed by Arundell and five others.
LJ, xi, 276.
p.496.

did.unittitle: BROWNE, JOHN, D.1691

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
Autograph MS.
Orders of the House, list of penal
laws, and debates concerning

p.497-498 and 516-519.

did.unittitle: ESSEX, ARTHUR CAPEL, 1ST EARL OF, 1631-1685

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:

did.unittitle: POVEY, MERCY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
4 p.
MS copy.
Criticizes dissenters who complain of
their persecution.
p.502-505.

did.unittitle: FAGEL, GASPER, 1629-1688

"A letter writ by Mijn Heer Fagel, pensioner of Holland, to Mr. James Stewart, Advocate, giving an account of the Prince and Princess of Orange's thoughts concerning the repeal of the Test, and the Penal Laws" 1687 Nov 4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
7 p.
MS copy. Published in London, 1688.
Sir James Stewart (1635-1715);
William III, King of Great Britain
(1650-1702); Mary II, Queen of Great
Britain (1662-1694).
p.506-512.

did.unittitle: [ANONYMOUS]
"A letter written by a Jesuit at London to the College at Liege, intercepted and carried to the Prince of Orange" [1688/9 Feb 2]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
3 p.
MS copy.
On the favor shown to Jesuits by King
James II. A version printed in 1688.
p.513-515.

did.unittitle: PETRE, EDWARD, 1631-1699

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
6 p.
MS copy.
On affairs in England. Printed in
1688.
p.520-525.

did.unittitle: PARTRIDGE, JOHN, 1644-1715
"Judicium Astrologicum pro Anno 1688" [1687]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
11 p.
MS copy.
Astrological notes on political
events. Printed in 1689 under title
"Annus Mirabilis or Strange and
Wonderful Predictions and
Observations Gathered out of
Mr.J.Partidges Almanack."
p.527-537.

did.unittitle: LA CHAISE, FRANCOIS D'AIX, 1627-1709

MS copy.
